intro: Ruellia linearibracteolata, commonly known as the narrow bract ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue to purple, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens. Ruellia linearibracteolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to a variety of soil types.
